Package javelin.model.world.location

Class WildEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.WildEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class WildEvent
extends Actor
    A mostly ad-hoc (scaled) type of Location meant to make the regions of the game World more interesting to explore regardless of a Squad's current level. It also adds variety to the rest of the mostly Fight-oriented encounters with lighter strategic decision making and subquests. For that same reason, avoid designing Fight-based events. Events and Hazards have a litte overlap but Events are more of a one-in-a-lifetime occurence (at least stylistically) while hazards represent the daily struggles of naviagting a certain type of terrain. TODO should probably be an Actor, not a location.
    See Also:
    WildEventCard, Serialized Form

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(int attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion.reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Specified by:
        getel in class Actor
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)
